name: St. Rabanus Maurus

locations.description: Abbot of Fulda, later Archbishop of Mainz

summary: Rabanus Maurus was a Frankish Benedictine monk, abbot, and theologian. He was a student of Alcuin and became one of the most learned men of his time. He served as abbot of Fulda and later as Archbishop of Mainz. He wrote extensively on theology, education, and biblical exegesis, and was a key figure in the Carolingian Renaissance.
